ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL=SAS-label ] 
      
Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the
SAS catalog or external file reference.

[Syntax: NAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

Syntax: REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | REPOSITORY=SAS-file-reference 
      
Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model
specification.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FORECAST options;
      
The FORECAST statement specifies the operations to be performed on the response
series as well as the autoregressive and moving average polynomials in the
model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SYMBOL=variable ] 
      
Specifies a symbolic name for the dependent series.

Syntax: DIF=order | DIF=( order1, order2, ...) 
      
Specifies the differencing orders for the dependent series.

Syntax: P=order 
  P=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) 
  P=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> 
      
Specifies the autoregressive part of the model.

Syntax: Q=order 
  Q=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) 
  Q=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk>  
      
Specifies the moving average part of the model.

[Syntax: AR=value ... ]  
      
Lists starting values for the autoregressive parameters.

[Syntax: MA=value ... ]  
      
Lists starting values for the moving average parameters.

[Syntax: NOCONSTANT ]  
      
Suppresses the fitting of a constant (or intercept) parameter in the model.

[Syntax: MU=value ]  
      
Specifies the MU parameter.

[Syntax: NOISEVAR=value ]  
      
Specifies the noise variance. This is useful only if you want to specify an
externally published model that is fully specified.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM=option ]  
      
Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRANSOPT=option ]  
      
Specifies that mean or median forecasts be estimated.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Mean forecasts are estimated. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: (SYMBOL|VAR)=variable ] 
      
Specifies a symbolic name for the dependent series.

[Syntax: PREDEFINED=option ] 
      
Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this
transfer function.

[Syntax: DIF=order | DIF=( order1, order2, ...) ] 
      
Specifies the differencing orders for the input series.

[Syntax: DELAY=order ] 
      
Specifies the delay (or lag) order for the input series.

[Syntax: NUM=order 
  NUM= (lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) 
  NUM= (lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> ] 
      
Specifies the numerator polynomial of the transfer function.

[Syntax: DEN=order 
  DEN= (lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) 
  DEN= (lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk>] 
      
Specifies the denominator polynomial of the transfer function.

[Syntax: NC=value ... ] 
      
Lists starting values for the numerator polynomial coefficients.

[Syntax: DC=value ...] 
      
Lists starting values for the denominator polynomial coefficients.

[Syntax: NZ=value ] 
      
Specifies the scale parameter—that is, the zero degree coefficient of the numerator.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM=option ] 
      
Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ESTIMATE options;
      
This is an optional statement in the procedure. Here you can specify the
estimation method or whether to hold the model parameters fixed to their
starting values. You can also specify some parameters that control the
nonlinear optimization process.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: METHOD=option ] 
      
Specifies the estimation method to use.

[Syntax: NOEST ] 
      
Uses the values specified with the AR=, MA=, and so on, as final parameter
values. The estimation process is suppressed except for the estimation of the
residual variance.

[Syntax: CONVERGE=value ] 
      
Specifies the convergence criterion.

[Syntax: DELTA=value ] 
      
Specifies the perturbation value for computing numerical derivatives.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n ] 
      
Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed.

[Syntax: NOLS ] 
      
Begins the maximum likelihood or unconditional least squares iterations from
the preliminary estimates rather than from the conditional least squares
estimates that are produced after four iterations.

[Syntax: NOSTABLE ] 
      
Specifies that the autoregressive and moving average parameter estimates for
the noise part of the model not be restricted to the stationary and invertible
regions, respectively.

[Syntax: SINGULAR=value ] 
      
Specifies the criterion for checking singularity.
[Help info is not currently available.]
